New Records: The Suns improved to 8-1 for the first time since 2009-10
Key Match Events: Jusuf Nurkic made the second of two free throws with 0.8 seconds left to lift the Suns to a 114-113 victory over the Mavericks
Daniel Gafford got Dallas even at 113 on an alley-oop dunk from Luka Doncic
Royce O'Neale missed a runner in the lane in the final seconds, but Nurkic grabbed the rebound and was bumped by several Dallas defenders on a missed shot as the buzzer sounded
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin Durant scored 26 points, and Nurkic had 15 points and 10 rebounds as the Suns improved to 8-1 for the first time since 2009-10
Miscellaneous Highlights: Suns reserves outscoring the Dallas bench 28-9
O'Neale was 7 of 8 from the field
Nurkic had all three of his offensive rebounds in the fourth quarter
Others: Dereck Lively II out because of a sprained shoulder
Dwight Powell was forced to play a season-high 25 minutes and had five fouls
